Austin libraries

For 30 days between March 19th and April 17th, 2016, I visited a different library in Austin and posted to my microblog about each one. The best libraries can be wonderful, quiet places to work. I always brought my iPad Pro with me to do some writing.

Here are the libraries, with the date linked to each post:

  • Cedar Park Public Library — Mar 19 (photo)
  • Wells Branch Community Library — Mar 20 (photo)
  • Little Walnut Creek Branch — Mar 21
  • North Village Branch — Mar 22
  • Old Quarry Branch — Mar 23
  • Howson Branch — Mar 24 (photo)
  • Westbank Community Library — Mar 25 (photo)
  • Yarborough Branch — Mar 26
  • a Little Free Library — Mar 27 (photo)
  • Spicewood Springs Branch — Mar 28
  • Laura Bush Community Library — Mar 29 (photo)
  • Pflugerville Public Library — Mar 30
  • Manchaca Road Branch — Mar 31
  • Faulk Central Library — Apr 1
  • Austin Community College Riverside — Apr 2
  • another Little Free Library — Apr 3 (photo)
  • Ruiz Branch — Apr 4 (photo)
  • University Hills Branch — Apr 5
  • Perry-Castañeda Library at UT — Apr 6
  • Round Rock Public Library — Apr 7
  • Hampton Branch — Apr 8
  • Lake Travis Community Library — Apr 9 (photo)
  • a 3rd Little Free Library — Apr 10
  • Twin Oaks Branch — Apr 11
  • Bee Cave Public Library — Apr 12 (photo)
  • Leander Public Library — Apr 13 (photo)
  • Pleasant Hill Branch — Apr 14
  • Terrazas Branch — Apr 15
  • Windsor Park Branch — Apr 16 (photo)
  • Architecture & Planning Library at UT — Apr 17

I also wrote a post after 1 week and a final wrap-up post.
